description.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting sociocultural issues relating to children's rights are implemented., which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is efficiently coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards for achieving results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategies to address cross-cutting sociocultural issues relating to children’s rights are implemented.

description.narrative: Communication, advocacy and partnership actions were geared to reinforce UNICEF's leadership at both strategic and operational levels in the fights against COVID-19 pandemic in Cameroon. At institutional level, UNICEF networked with parliamentarian, private section and media to improve the quality of the national response against the pandemic. At operational level, UNICEF trained junior parliamentarians, private sector and media. Videos produced with major icons were aired on major TV and UNICEF social media platforms on preventive measures of the pandemic. The implementation of resources mobilization strategy yielded US 4,926,007 by major donors KOICA, ECHO, KfW, Canada, GPE, OFDA, DFID, JAPAN, CHINA | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020
